courses.name: DSA
courses.description: DSA can stand for Data Structures and Algorithms, a computer science concept for organizing data and creating efficient procedures to solve problems, or Digital Signature Algorithm, a public-key cryptosystem for verifying digital signatures. A third meaning is Digital Subtraction Angiography, a medical imaging technique to visualize blood vessels in the brain.

courses.name: OOP
courses.description: Object-oriented programming (OOP) is a programming paradigm that organizes software around data, or which combine data and functions into a single unit. It models real-world objects and their interactions, making code more reusable, secure, and easier to maintain. OOP is built on four main principles: encapsulation, abstraction, inheritance, and polymorphism.
